objectives: Learn to name and describe common festivals and celebrations in English.
Practice using English words to talk about activities we do during festivals.
Share simple information about our village festivals and culture with others.

sections.text: Festivals and celebrations are special days or times when people come together to have fun, remember important things, or thank God. They bring happiness, joy, and a feeling of togetherness to our families and village.

examples.label: Festivals are special days.
examples.value: Like Diwali, Holi, or Eid. They are not like normal days.

examples.label: We celebrate with family and friends.
examples.value: People gather at home, visit relatives, and spend time together.

examples.label: They bring happiness.
examples.value: Everyone feels joyful and excited during festivals.

examples.label: They are about culture and tradition.
examples.value: We follow special customs passed down by our elders.

examples.label: We get holidays from school.
examples.value: Schools and offices are closed on major festivals.

examples.label: We eat special food.
examples.value: Mothers and grandmothers cook delicious dishes.

usage_examples: Our village celebrates many **festivals** every year.
**Celebrations** make us happy and bring us closer.
Festivals are a time for **joy** and fun.
We enjoy every **special occasion** in our village.
Many **customs** and **traditions** are followed during festivals.
A **celebration** is a time of great **happiness** for everyone.
The entire **community** participates in the festival.
These special days break the routine of our normal **life**.
Festivals are a time for **togetherness** and sharing.
We learn about our **culture** through these celebrations.
There is a festive **atmosphere** all around.
We get a **holiday** from school to celebrate with our family.
Each festival has its own unique **story** and importance.
We remember our **heritage** during these events.
It is a time for **gratitude** and prayer.

topics.title: 2. Common Festivals in Our Village and Country

sections.text: Diwali is a very important and bright festival. It is known as the 'Festival of Lights'. We light many lamps (diyas) and burst fireworks.

examples.label: Lights and Diyas
examples.value: Small lamps made of clay or bulbs that light up our homes.

examples.label: Sweets
examples.value: Special sweet dishes are made and shared, like laddus and barfis.

examples.label: Fireworks
examples.value: Colorful explosions in the sky that make a loud sound.

examples.label: Laxmi Puja
examples.value: We pray to Goddess Laxmi for wealth and prosperity.

examples.label: New Clothes
examples.value: Everyone wears new dresses to feel festive.

examples.label: Rangoli
examples.value: Beautiful patterns made on the floor with colored powders.

examples.label: Gifts
examples.value: People exchange gifts with friends and family.

usage_examples: On **Diwali**, we light many **diyas** around our home.
My mother makes delicious **sweets** for **Diwali**.
Children love to burst **fireworks** at night.
We wear new clothes and visit relatives during **Diwali**.
The whole village shines brightly on **Diwali** night.
We clean our houses well before **Diwali**.
My sister makes a beautiful **rangoli** at our doorstep.
We perform **Laxmi Puja** in the evening.
We **exchange gifts** with our neighbors.
Diwali is a five-day **festival**.
The market is very **crowded** before Diwali.
There is a feeling of **happiness** everywhere.
We get a long **holiday** for Diwali.
My father buys many **crackers** for us.
The houses look beautiful with all the **lights**.

sections.text: Holi is a very joyful and colorful festival. People play with dry colors (gulal) and colored water. It is a day for fun and forgetting old differences.

examples.label: Colors (Gulal)
examples.value: Bright powders like red, green, blue, yellow, used to apply on others.

examples.label: Colored Water
examples.value: Water mixed with colors, splashed using pichkaris (water guns) or buckets.

examples.label: Sweets (Gujiya)
examples.value: Special sweets like Gujiya are eaten.

examples.label: Bonfire (Holika Dahan)
examples.value: A large fire lit the night before Holi, symbolizing victory of good over evil.

examples.label: Pichkari
examples.value: A water gun used to spray colored water.

examples.label: Dancing and Singing
examples.value: People dance to the beat of drums and sing folk songs.

examples.label: Friendship
examples.value: A day to forgive others and renew friendships.

usage_examples: On **Holi**, we play with many bright **colors**.
Children fill their **pichkaris** with **colored water**.
We eat tasty **gujiyas** with our friends.
Everyone is happy and enjoys **Holi**.
The village square has a big **bonfire** for Holika Dahan.
My face was full of different **colors** after playing Holi.
People apply **gulal** on each other's faces.
We splash **water balloons** on our friends.
There is loud **music** and **dancing** everywhere.
Holi is a festival of **joy** and **friendship**.
We hug our friends and say '**Happy Holi**'.
The atmosphere is very **lively** and **energetic**.
We forget all our worries and just have **fun**.
My mother prepares a special **feast** on Holi.
After playing, we take a long **bath** to wash off the colors.

subtopics.title: 2.3. Eid: The Festival of Joy and Giving

sections.text: Eid is an important festival celebrated by Muslims. It is a time for prayers, feasting, and sharing joy and gifts with family and friends, especially after a month of fasting.

examples.label: Special Prayers (Namaz)
examples.value: Muslims offer special prayers at the mosque.

examples.label: New Clothes
examples.value: People wear new and clean clothes to celebrate.

examples.label: Sheer Khurma
examples.value: A special sweet dish made from vermicelli, milk, and dry fruits.

examples.label: Eidi
examples.value: Money or gifts given by elders to younger family members.

examples.label: Sharing Food
examples.value: Food is prepared and shared with family, neighbors, and those in need.

examples.label: Hugging
examples.value: People hug each other and say 'Eid Mubarak'.

examples.label: Charity (Zakat)
examples.value: Giving alms or help to the poor is an important part of Eid.

usage_examples: On **Eid**, we offer **special prayers** in the mosque.
Everyone wears **new clothes** for **Eid** celebrations.
My mother makes delicious **sheer khurma**.
My uncle gave me **Eidi** on **Eid**.
We invite our **neighbors** to share food during **Eid**.
The atmosphere is full of **joy** and warmth on this day.
People greet each other by saying '**Eid Mubarak**'.
Eid marks the end of the holy month of **Ramadan**.
We visit the homes of our **relatives** and friends.
It is a festival of **brotherhood** and **peace**.
Children are very **excited** to receive Eidi.
We give **charity** to the poor and needy.
A grand **feast** is prepared for the family.
We **forgive** each other for past mistakes.
The whole **community** comes together to celebrate.

sections.text: These festivals are celebrated by farmers to thank nature and God for a good harvest (when crops are ready). They are a time of abundance and gratitude.

examples.label: Harvest
examples.value: The time when crops like rice, wheat, or sugarcane are gathered from the fields.

examples.label: Thanking Nature
examples.value: These festivals honor the hard work of farmers and thank the earth, sun, and rain.

examples.label: Special Food (Pongal/Til Ladoo)
examples.value: Dishes made from freshly harvested grains or seasonal sweets.

examples.label: Kite Flying (Makar Sankranti)
examples.value: A popular activity in many regions during Makar Sankranti, where colorful kites fill the sky.

examples.label: Bonfires
examples.value: Large fires are lit, especially during Lohri and Bihu.

examples.label: Traditional Dances
examples.value: People perform folk dances like Bhangra (Baisakhi) or Bihu.

examples.label: Fairs (Mela)
examples.value: Many villages organize fairs with rides, food, and games.

usage_examples: Farmers celebrate **harvest festivals** after their crops are ready.
On **Makar Sankranti**, we fly many colorful **kites**.
My mother prepares special **til ladoos** for this festival.
We offer prayers for a good **harvest** every year.
These festivals show our **gratitude** to nature.
We celebrate **Pongal** in our village to thank the Sun God.
During **Baisakhi**, farmers dance the **Bhangra** with joy.
A big **mela** (fair) is organized in our village for the harvest festival.
People gather around a **bonfire** at night during Lohri.
The sky looks beautiful with so many **kites**.
We thank our **cattle** for helping us in the fields.
It is a time of **prosperity** and **happiness** for the farming community.
New **rice** is cooked as a special offering.
These festivals connect us to our **agriculture** and land.
We share the newly harvested **grains** with our neighbors.

sections.text: Before any big festival, families get busy preparing. These preparations are part of the fun!

examples.label: Clean the house
examples.value: Making our homes neat and tidy for the festival.

examples.label: Decorate
examples.value: Putting up lights, rangoli, flowers, and other beautiful things.

examples.label: Shop for new clothes
examples.value: Buying new shirts, saris, or other dresses to wear on the special day.

examples.label: Prepare special food
examples.value: Cooking delicious and traditional dishes that are only made during festivals.

examples.label: Buy ingredients
examples.value: Going to the market to buy things needed for cooking.

examples.label: Make rangoli
examples.value: Creating colorful patterns on the floor.

examples.label: Invite guests
examples.value: Asking relatives and friends to come to our home.

usage_examples: My family always **cleans the house** before Diwali.
We **decorate** our home with colorful lights.
My mother and I **shop for new clothes** for Eid.
Grandmother **prepares special sweets** like ladoos and halwa.
The entire village gets busy with **preparations**.
We buy fresh flowers to **decorate** the temple.
My father went to the market to **buy groceries** for the feast.
My sister is very good at **making rangoli**.
We **invite** all our relatives for the celebration.
The feeling of **anticipation** makes the preparation exciting.
We all **work together** to get the house ready.
My brother helps my father **put up the lights**.
My mother soaks rice and lentils to **prepare batter** for special dishes.
We **white-wash** the walls of our house before the festival.
There is a lot of **hustle and bustle** in the market during this time.

sections.text: On the festival day, we do many things together with our family and friends. These actions show our joy and togetherness.

examples.label: Wear new clothes
examples.value: Putting on fresh, new garments to look good for the occasion.

examples.label: Visit relatives
examples.value: Going to meet our aunts, uncles, cousins, and other family members.

examples.label: Share food
examples.value: Giving and eating special dishes with everyone.

examples.label: Sing and Dance
examples.value: Expressing happiness through songs and traditional dances.

examples.label: Pray
examples.value: Offering prayers to God or deities in temples, mosques, or at home.

examples.label: Exchange gifts
examples.value: Giving small presents to loved ones.

examples.label: Feast
examples.value: Eating a large and special meal together.

examples.label: Receive blessings
examples.value: Touching the feet of elders to get their good wishes.

usage_examples: We **wear new clothes** on every festival.
On Eid, we **visit our relatives** in the next village.
My mother **shares food** with our neighbors.
During festivals, we **sing and dance** with joy.
Many people **pray** at the temple in the morning.
Children love to **receive gifts** during Diwali.
We all **gather** at our grandfather's house to **celebrate**.
The whole family has a big **feast** together.
We **greet** our friends and neighbors happily.
We touch the feet of our elders to **receive blessings**.
The village square is filled with people **enjoying** the celebration.
Kids **burst crackers** with their parents.
We **participate** in the temple procession.
There is a feeling of **unity** and **brotherhood**.
We **create** happy memories during these times.

sections.text: Here are some verbs that describe the actions we do during festivals and celebrations.

examples.label: Celebrate
examples.value: To observe a special day or event with festivities.

examples.label: Light
examples.value: To make something bright with fire or electricity (e.g., diyas, lamps).

examples.label: Decorate
examples.value: To make something look attractive by adding things.

examples.label: Wear
examples.value: To have clothes or jewelry on your body.

examples.label: Visit
examples.value: To go to see a person or place.

examples.label: Share
examples.value: To give a part of something to others.

examples.label: Pray
examples.value: To speak to God, asking for help or giving thanks.

examples.label: Exchange
examples.value: To give something and receive something in return.

examples.label: Gather
examples.value: To come together in a group.

examples.label: Feast
examples.value: To eat a large, special meal.

examples.label: Sing
examples.value: To make musical sounds with your voice.

examples.label: Dance
examples.value: To move your body to music.

usage_examples: We **celebrate** Holi with great excitement.
We **light** candles and lamps on Diwali.
My sister loves to **decorate** the house.
Everyone **wears** traditional clothes.
We **visit** our friends' houses to exchange greetings.
It is important to **share** happiness with everyone.
Families often **pray** together during festivals.
Children **burst** firecrackers safely.
We **prepare** special dishes.
Our family **gathers** for a big dinner.
We **exchange** sweets with our neighbours.
People **sing** folk songs during the harvest festival.
We **feast** on delicious food.
The women **dance** in a circle.
We **greet** each other with a warm hug.

subtopics.title: 4.1. Describing a Festival to Someone New

sections.text: When you want to tell someone about a festival from your village or culture, use these simple sentences. This helps others understand our traditions.

examples.label: Introduction
examples.value: Our village celebrates [Festival Name].

examples.label: Type of Festival
examples.value: It is a festival of [lights/colors/joy/harvest].

examples.label: Main Activity
examples.value: We usually [main activity, e.g., light diyas / play with colors].

examples.label: What we eat
examples.value: We prepare special [food items, e.g., sweets / rice dishes].

examples.label: Reason for Celebration
examples.value: We celebrate it because [reason, e.g., it marks the victory of good over evil].

examples.label: Feeling/Atmosphere
examples.value: Everyone feels [feeling, e.g., happy and excited].

usage_examples: **Our village celebrates Diwali** with great enthusiasm.
**It is a festival of lights** and new beginnings.
**We usually clean our homes** and make beautiful rangolis.
**We prepare special sweets** and share them with neighbors.
On Holi, **we play with colors** and splash water.
**It is a festival of fun** and friendship.
**Our community gathers** for special prayers on Eid.
**We enjoy singing** traditional songs during festivals.
Makar Sankranti is a **harvest festival**.
During this festival, **we thank the Sun God** for good crops.
**The main attraction is kite flying**.
**I like this festival because** my whole family comes together.
**It is a very old tradition** in our village.
**The celebration lasts for three days**.
**Everyone, young and old, participates** in the fun.

sections.text: These words help you talk about the shared beliefs, customs, and ways of life in your village or community.

examples.label: Tradition
examples.value: A belief or way of doing things that has been passed down for a long time.

examples.label: Custom
examples.value: A usual way of behaving or doing something in a particular society or group.

examples.label: Community
examples.value: A group of people living in the same place and sharing things.

examples.label: Ceremony
examples.value: A formal event or ritual, often religious or social.

examples.label: Gathering
examples.value: A meeting or coming together of people.

examples.label: Culture
examples.value: The customs, ideas, and social behavior of a society.

examples.label: Heritage
examples.value: Features belonging to the culture of a society, such as traditions, that have been passed down.

examples.label: Ritual
examples.value: A religious or solemn ceremony consisting of a series of actions performed in a set order.

examples.label: Procession
examples.value: A number of people moving forward in an orderly way, especially as part of a ceremony.

usage_examples: It is our family **tradition** to light a diya every evening.
Wearing new clothes on festivals is a common **custom**.
Our village **community** celebrates all festivals together.
There was a special **ceremony** at the temple last week.
We had a big family **gathering** for my sister's wedding.
Our **culture** is rich with many colorful festivals.
We share **stories** of our **heritage** during festivals.
The morning prayer is a daily **ritual** in our home.
A colorful **procession** moves through the village on the festival day.
It is our **belief** that God protects us.
The village fair is an important part of our local **culture**.
We are proud of our cultural **heritage**.
This **custom** has been followed for hundreds of years.
The wedding **ceremony** was beautiful.
A sense of **community** is very strong in our village.
